poem:
**Nurturing Needs**

In the womb of our schools,  
seeds of dreams—some frail, some bold—  
take root in soil tilled by tiny hands.  
Yet, whispers go unheard in echoing halls;  
cries lost in labyrinths of indifference.  
Let us mend the soil,  
nourish early with care,  
so every dream may rise and meet the sun.
